TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LoginDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the Web-server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control displays a user interface that allows a user to log on to the host Web site.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The LoginDesigner class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.
The LoginDesigner class properties provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control and the top-level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> template.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> to generate the design-time markup.
The LoginDesigner class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method returns a serialized copy of the template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method provides the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> at design time when an error has occurred.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method sets a region of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> from a serialized copy of a control template.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the LoginDesigner class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyLogin` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>. The `MyLogin` is a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control. The example also derives the `MyLoginDesigner` class from the LoginDesigner and applies a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute for the `MyLoginDesigner` on the `MyLogin` control.
The `MyLoginDesigner` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to make the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid at design time. It overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to draw a blue, dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the `MyLogin` control is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value. It overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup for a placeholder that includes the error message rendered in red, bold text.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.w_19_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_19_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action-list collection for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ActionLists property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object that is obtained from the ActionLists base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the control allows resizing.
Docs.value: if the control allows resizing; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.RenderOuterTable%2A> property is set to `false`, the control does not allow resizing.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of predefined formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
Docs.value: A that contains the predefined schemes for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed

Docs.param: A to which definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the control are added.
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
Docs.returns: A string containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method creates an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control and adds it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> object that is referenced by the `regions` parameter. The GetDesignTimeHtml method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control at design time. The example draws a blue, dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/d1888c77-454a-4aa8-a063-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/d1888c77-454a-4aa8-a063-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed

Docs.param: The for which to fetch content.
Docs.summary: Returns a serialized copy of the template that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A string containing a serialized copy of the template used to render the associated at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method creates a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> object of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control in the control container and returns a serialized copy.
The serialized template can be restored to a part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
The `region` parameter is not used by the GetEditableDesignerRegionContent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the markup used to render the associated at design time after an error has occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The placeholder that the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control renders contains the type name, the control name, and messages announcing and describing the error.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetErrorDesignTimeHtml method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control at design time. The example generates the markup for a placeholder that includes the error message rendered in red, bold text.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/5697643a-0895-4726-857c-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/5697643a-0895-4726-857c-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The visual designer calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control. The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
If a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> property has been defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control, the PreFilterProperties sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> attribute of properties that do not apply when templated to `false` so those properties do not appear in the **Properties** grid.
## Examples The following code sample creates a class derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner>, and overrides the PreFilterProperties method to change the **Properties** grid of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control at design time. The example makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the **Properties** grid.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/8e9b3681-5bd0-43e5-8f39-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/8e9b3681-5bd0-43e5-8f39-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
Docs.value: if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> control uses an outer table container to apply inline style rule in the markup. You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to `true`. Removing the outer table gives you greater flexibility in how you apply CSS rules to the markup that is rendered by the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides the name of the region to update.
A string that contains a serialized template for the associated control.
Docs.summary: Sets a region of the associated control from a serialized copy of a control template.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method parses a serialized template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control that is specified by the `content` parameter, and then uses the template to update the region of the control that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerObject.Name%2A> property of the `region` parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control can be serialized using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.
Docs.value: A containing an element for each templated field in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TemplateGroups property gets a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object from the TemplateGroups base property, and then adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> object that contains a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for the layout template of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection>. The TemplateGroups property returns this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> to the caller.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property creates the copy by persisting the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control, then parsing the persisted control string. The copied control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.
If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer uses the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
